required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Endurance Exercise and Histamine Receptors on the Gene Expression in Skeletal Muscle
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Endurance Training and Histamine Receptor Antagonists on the Transcriptome Response in Human Muscle

brief_summary.textblock: Blocking histamine H1/H2 receptors blunts chronic endurance training adaptations. The current study addresses a twofold research question: "What is the influence of endurance training (1) and histamine H1 and H2 signaling (2) on the gene expression in human skeletal muscle." Results from this study will yield more insights into the molecular mechanisms of adaptations to exercise training.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomized double-blinded placebo-controlled cross-over interventional study

primary_outcome.time_frame: On each test-day: 0 minutes after the exercise training versus at rest.
On each test-day: 180 minutes after the exercise training versus at rest.
On each test-day: 0 minutes after the exercise training versus at rest.
primary_outcome.description: Fluorometric determination of muscle glycogen levels

primary_outcome.time_frame: On each test-day: 180 minutes after the exercise training versus at rest.
primary_outcome.description: Fluorometric determination of muscle glycogen levels

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from rest to different time-points after exercise (0, 30, 60, 120 and 180 minutes after the exercise training).
primary_outcome.description: Plasma volume based on hemoglobin and hematocrit concentration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart rate during the exercise training
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Continuously during training on each test-day.
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate during the exercise training.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: On each test-day at 10 time-points: at rest, during exercise and 0, 30, 60, 120 and 180 minutes after the exercise training.
On each test-day at 10 time-points: at rest, during exercise and 0, 30, 60, 120 and 180 minutes after the exercise training.
On each test-day at 6 time-points: at rest and 0, 30, 60, 120 and 180 minutes after the exercise training.
On each test-day at 6 time-points: at rest and 0, 30, 60, 120 and 180 minutes after the exercise training.

secondary_outcome.measure: Muscle signaling pathways relevant for glucose metabolism and cardiovascular health
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On each test-day: at rest, 0 minutes and 180 minutes after the exercise training.
secondary_outcome.description: Phosphorylation status of proteins assessed by Western Blotting

intervention.description: Oral placebo Exercise training: Interval-based cycling exercise

intervention.intervention_name: H1 blockade: H1 receptor antagonist + exercise training
intervention.description: H1 blockade: oral blockade Exercise training: Interval-based cycling exercise

intervention.intervention_name: H2 Blockade: H2 receptor antagonist + exercise training
intervention.description: H2 blockade: oral blockade Exercise training: Interval-based cycling exercise

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female
- 18-45 years
- not to medium physically active
Exclusion Criteria:
- Smoking
- Chronic disease
- Supplement or medication intake
- Seasonal allergies

facility.name: Department of movement and sports sciences, Ghent University, Belgium
